toggle.heading: Here are the best colleges in the U.S.

hero.title: Best National University Rankings
hero.description: Schools in the National Universities category, such as the University of Chicago and Carnegie Mellon University, offer a full range of undergraduate majors, plus master's and doctoral programs. These colleges also are committed to producing groundbreaking research.
hero.subtitle: Here are the best colleges in the U.S.

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Located in Midtown Detroit, Wayne State University offers more than 300 academic programs, 200 student organizations, Division II sports and many city attractions. Notable Wayne State graduates include the first African-American woman elected to a state Senate.

institution.footnote: This school declined to fill out the U.S. News & World Report main statistical survey. Data that appears is from either what the school reported in previous years or from another source, such as the National Center for Education Statistics.

acceptanceRate.noteText: Data reported to U.S. News in previous years

satAvg.noteText: Previous year's data was used in the ranking calculation.

actAvg.noteText: Previous year's data was used in the ranking calculation.

items.blurb: A public school in the small city of Morgantown, West Virginia University offers several degrees and is home to the Center for Service and Learning, which gives class credit for community service. Students can also get involved with Greek life, Division I sports and more than 400 student organizations.

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Founded in 1899, Azusa Pacific University is a private institution.
Founded in 1858, Baker University is a private institution. Baker University follows a 4-1-4-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered selective.

Founded in 1891, Delaware State University is a public institution. The school has 52.3% of its classes with fewer than 20 students, and the student-faculty ratio at Delaware State University is 16:1.

items.blurb: Founded in 1912, Inter American University of Puerto Rico--San German is a private institution.

items.blurb: Montana State University is home to many unique research facilities, such as the Plant Growth Center and the Center for Bison and Wildlife Health. Notable alumni include Jan Stenerud, one of the few Pro Football Hall of Fame placekickers.

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Old Dominion University is a state school located in Norfolk, Virginia. The ODU sports teams compete in the NCAA Division I Conference USA.

satAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

actAvg.noteText: SAT and/or ACT not required by school for some or all applicants.

items.blurb: Founded in 1875, Shenandoah University is a private institution.

items.blurb: Founded in 1869, Southern Illinois University--Carbondale is a public institution. Southern Illinois University--Carbondale follows a semester-based academic calendar and its admissions are considered selective.

utag_data.stitial_fact: 1. In 2014, the top three destination countries for international students, in order of popularity, were the U.S., the U.K. and China.
